* @param by The deadline of the task.

* A constructor that creates an instance of Task.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Sets this task as done or not done, depending on the given command.
* @param command The command that determines whether this task is done or not done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + this.toString());
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + this.toString());
* Returns a String that reflects whether this task is done or not done.
* @return Returns an "X" or " " depending on whether this task is done.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a String that is written to a file to be stored.
* @return A String formatted to be stored.
* Checks whether this Task's description contains the String to be found.

* @return true if the description contains the String to be found, false otherwise.
private static ArrayList<Task> storage = new ArrayList<>();
* A constructor that returns an instance of TaskList.
* @param saveFile Handles storing Tasks in the hard disk.
* Adds Tasks to storage and saves them to the hard disk.
*  Removes the specified Task from storage if it exists.
*  If the specified Task does not exist, a statement telling the user that
*  the specified does not exist is printed.
* @param index The index of the Task to be removed from storage.

* Tells the user what Task was added and how many Tasks are in the list.

+ "Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list. \n"
* Informs the user that the task they tried to access does not exist.

+ "â˜¹ OOPS!!! The description of an Event cannot be empty. \n"

+ "â˜¹ OOPS!!! Unknown element in save file. \n"
* Tells the user that Duke was unable to add their task to the list.

* Tells the user that their input was not recognised as a command.
+ "â˜¹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-( \n"

+ "Bye. Hope to see you again soon! \n"
